fields.description:
If you open an epic, then clicks the "+" button to add a subtask to it,
you get a registration window with the epic link filled in.

If you then fill in some fields wrong (for instance don't fill in a mandatory value), you get an error message, and *the epic link is cleared*.

fields.description:
As an Ops team, we track "releases" of our work in progress by simply labeling them from the Done column when we reach our WIP limit in that column; typically, these align with iterations on the development side plus a monotonically increasing version number (i13.04, i13.05, etc.) 

The release screen gives no indication as to the previous "version", requiring us to check the versions tab of the project to confirm whether this is release 05 or 06, etc.

Displaying the previous version or couple versions on the release screen would give context to the next version being labeled.
fields.summary: The "release" screen from Kanban views should display the last n versions released

Ability to Rename Closed Sprint

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Following a certain sequence of events causes JIRA Agile to submit the incorrect action ID to WorkflowUIDDispatcher.jspa and subsequently display an error that the Workflow Action is Invalid even when it is not.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Configure the workflow and board as per the affected data.
# Create a new issue and drag it into a sprint.
# Create a sub-task.
# Close the sub-task and acknowledge the system message that the parent issue cannot be closed as there is no known transition.
# Transition the parent issue forward in the workflow.
# Attempt to transition it again.

h3. Expected Results

It transitions without fail.

h3. Actual Results

The "Workflow Action Invalid" error is displayed.

h3. Notes

Refreshing the issue and trying again as in the link will cause it to be successful.

An attached HAR shows the web calls the client is making - this appears to be a bug within the Javascript.
fields.summary: Dragging an issue on the work board displays Workflow Action Invalid when it is valid

fields.description:
As a scrum team member, I want the Agile Sprint Health Gadget on dashboard to reflect, not only the stories / main tasks, but also the subs (optional setting)

Details:
So, the new nice Agile Sprint Health Gadget does not count sub-tasks. 

Since we are completing a lot of our total stories in the end of a sprint, this is a problem, the gadget does not reflect the actual progress in terms of total issues. 

Eg. 8 stories are in a sprint, they have 5 sub-tasks each, the gadget only shows the 8, not the total 40, or 48 if you would count the Stories.
fields.summary: Agile Sprint Health Gadget not counting sub-tasks

fields.description:
A couple of simple use cases:
1.  Team member inadvertently adds a story to an iteration
2.  Team member forgets to add story points to a story at the beginning of an iteration

The velocity is then calculated incorrectly.  Thus, the velocity charts are useless.  You can claim - make sure to get it right before starting an iteration - but that's unrealistic - mistakes happen.  Thus, I as an administrator want the ability to fix the mistakes - but I don't want everyone to.

What I am forced to do is to create velocity reports outside of jira and that's getting to be a large amount of time when you have 20 teams to do this for!
fields.summary: As an administrator, I would like to adjust things in an iteration

fields.description:
In our documentation at https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Velocity, it says:
The velocity can be estimated as the average, over several recent sprints, of the sum of the estimates for the amount of work completed by a team per sprint.
According to the files found inside: includes/js/rapid/ui/chart of the plugin code ReleaseDatePredictor.js and VersionReportController.js, the calculation is being done based only in the current sprint and the customer would like to be based in the last few sprints, not only the active one. That way the calculation would be more accurate.
fields.summary: Ability to change the nunber of sprints took in consideration to calculate velocity

fields.description:
Background: For those of us that either practice scrumban or happen to have a large backlog of stories, planning view is starting to become a very nice tool for keeping the backlog in order with it version and epic views (components missing btw). Plain kanban board forces you to use plain JIRA for planning, involving several workflow states and even several projects if you have several kanban teams.

Possible way to implement: Use the exact same approach as done for scrum, as it allows two different teams to work on same issue pools thanks to sprint assignment. However dates can be skipped as the sprint will basically never end, instead a normal kanban mode deploy is done from time to time, while people still continue to work on issues in progress.
fields.summary: As a Kanban user I want planning view

fields.description: We utilize components in a jira project to identify different code repositories within the scope of one project. For example a project may have a front end JavaScript MVC application and a server side API as two distinct repositories. One may be released without the other and vice versa, so we created a board with two quick filters, one for each component. The problem is that when you view the board with a quick filter applied and they you hit the release link, the release modal opens and says that all of the tickets will be released, not just the ones currently on the board scoped by the quick filter. What I would expect is that when you release, you only release the tickets currently visible on the board.
fields.summary: Quick Filters should be applied to making a release

Ideally we'd actually want all of this information to be displayed in the order we want and way above the General Fields information, for us that isn't as relevant as the Description and BDD scenarios but we they are useful enough to have them available in this view.

fields.description:
TL;DR: It can be non trivial to get a list of unique projects which are returned by a given JQL query. If we list these out, then admins will be better able to troubleshoot permissions issues.

From a support ticket:

{code}The Agile Board will not allow you to create a sprint if you don't have appropriate permissions for all the projects covered by the board's filter. Unfortunately people sometimes inadvertently include a project through using links as part of their query, or where someone has been assigned some small task in another project. There could be just a couple of tasks from that project in the filter of hundreds of issues and this can be hard to find.

It would be great if on the Agile Board->Configuration->Filter screen you could show the list of projects that are being picked up by the current filter.

Often I get scrum masters asking me why the create sprint button is not working for them after they have created a new board or modified a filter. It was working before and now it isn't and they and I can't see why.

Also the Version Report can also have trouble when unexpected tasks appear in the filter (e.g. a task from another project but without its parent story).

Having a simple list of projects would be a very useful hint as to where there could be a problem. If there are any unexpected projects then that will be a great pointer.{code}
fields.summary: As a board administrator, I want to see a list of projects associated with a board

I believe this is happening because of the Sprint field, which is cloned as well. But this is not correct, since the permission to change a Sprint is the Administer Project, and an user without this permission can clone an Issue, he just need to have the Clone Issue permission.

Also, as a good practice in Agile, we are not supposed to add issues to an Active Sprint.
fields.summary: Cloned Issue is appearing in the Active Sprint

fields.description:
*+Current Behavior:+*
Currently, the *JIRA Agile Days Remaining in Sprint* gadget shows the days remaining as 0 during the last day of the sprint. 

+*Situation:*+
For example, I have a sprint that ends on Tuesday. Although Tuesday is technically the last day of the sprint, the developers still have all day to complete their work. Therefore, there should never be a count of zero days left as that implies it is the start of the next sprint.

The thought process behind the current behavior is that, technically at the end of Tuesday there is no time left in the sprint, so therefore there are zero days remaining then. 

+*Solution Suggested:*+
To avoid this, a potential fix could be updating the gadget to change to an hourly scale on the last day of the sprint. As time passes on the last day, devs will get a clear indication of how much time is left.
fields.summary: As a JIRA Agile user, I'd like to display the Days Remaining in Sprint gadget in an hourly scale

fields.description:
h4. Summary 
Earlier today I learned that non-working days is registered per board in Jira Agile instead of in one place as it was with Greenhopper (https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/212326/how-does-jira-agile-consider-non-working-days). 
We have several boards, and this basically means that I have to register the same X number of non-working days on every board we have in Jira around new years every year. 
It would be great to have the possibility to copy these days from one board to another (or perhaps have a general configuration for this that will be adopted for all boards by default), just to remove the work and the possibility of loosing out on one/picking the wrong one, etc.

h4. Workaround
(i) Tested in JIRA Agile 6.7.0
Use the following REST call:
{code}POST http://<jira-baseurl>/rest/greenhopper/1.0/rapidviewconfig/workingdays/nonworkingday/add{code}
With the following JSON data:
{code}{"rapidViewId":2,"iso8601Date":"2015-05-31"}{code}
Where rapidViewId is the ID of the Scrum board, and iso8601Date is date to be added. 
Taken from [Paul's comment|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-9833?focusedCommentId=720812&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-720812].
fields.summary: As a user I want to set non-working days for multiple boards at once

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1. Select an issue in a sprint
2. Make sure Detail View is closed
3. Drag an issue from the backlog (or another sprint) into the sprint with the selected issue.
4. Detail View opens (scrolling occurs).
fields.summary: Plan mode: Dragging an issue when another is selected causes Detail View to open

fields.description:
As a SE I get a lot of customers not aware of the best practices for using sub-tasks in SCRUM. This subsequently causes a lot of problems for users going from classic to rapid boards as a lot of the way things are handled in the new versions are different. We have some fantastic general docs in https://www.atlassian.com/agile/ - can you please expand this to have information about best practices on sub-tasks?

For example, expanding on:

# Create your user stories (aka tasks). Drag them and drop to the right version in the planning board.
# Create sub-tasks for them with your estimates.
# Add the stories to the sprint.
# Complete the sprint - any sub-tasks that are not completed will continue to be tracked on the story (the parent) when it's returned back to the backlog after the sprint is complete.
# The completed sub-tasks can be tracked with the Burndown chart.
# If there are further sub-tasks to be completed, they can be scheduled in the next sprint when the story is added to it.
fields.summary: Add best practices info for sub-tasks to JIRA Agile docs

fields.description: When creating an Epic on the Agile board the field will be set in the story/bug/feature and appear on that board.  However when moving to another board that has additional filter criteria in the query, the epic will not show up on the list even though the tag remains on the item itself.  (Please see attachment for a screen shot.  Is this intentional?
fields.summary: Epic not populating across agile boards

fields.description:
Hello,

I ran into an interesting situation which I do NOT have an explanation for. I had some co-workers setup a Rapid Board. They had two active sprints going on, one right after the other. (e.g. September 1 to September 7 for Sprint 1 and September 8 to September 15 for Sprint 2). What was going on was that they were trying to change the Sprint number on the issues from 2 to 1 or 1 to 2. Vise Versa and the Sprint field was marking on the issue "Extended Sprint". When they input the sprintid number (e.g. 73) they got it back to saying Sprint 2 otherwise just putting a two in put it back to Extended Sprint. They completed the first Sprint and these items still occurred.

The information I am trying to achieve is the following:

1. What causes the issue to display in the Sprint Field "EXTENDED SPRINT"?
2. Why would you need to put in the sprintid number (e.g. 73) to get the correct sprint number to display instead of just putting a 2 or 1 when your sprint is named "Sprint 2 or Sprint 1"?
3. What are some pointers to avoid in the future to avoid this happening again?

Anyways, any information on this would be much appreciated. Thank you
fields.summary: Request Information: I change Sprint number on issue and it displays "Extended Sprint"

fields.description: It would be great if we can change the number of results in the Filter search (editing the board filter) to bring more than 20 results.
fields.summary: Show more than 20 results in the board filter
On a Kanban board, the Plan mode disabled button has a hover state when it shouldn't
Version label incorrectly rendering special characters

fields.description:
When editing an issue, I want to be able to assign it to a sprint, so I made the sprint field visible. This creates a text field named "Sprint" with no drop-down, validation, or other expected UI. 

If you do a little digging you can figure out the numeric ID for a sprint, which works if you enter it in the field. But this certainly isn't acceptable, particularly for unsophisticated users.  The current implementation requires users to know which numeric IDs are which sprints, which is really not practical.
fields.summary: Sprint field should be a custom field with drop-down, validation, etc.

fields.description:
Some Issues are stucked on my board and I can not remove them. These issues are not visible on planning board, just on work board. I can move them on work board but cannot remove them, also closing them and creating new sprint didn't help.

Any ideas? I don't want to delete them.
fields.summary: Issues stuck on board

fields.description:
Jira Agile has good support for linking issues to Epics; but it doesn't have any support for linking features, improvements, bugs, tasks to Stories.  It would be great to have the ability to do this, so that the epic reports roll up from the individual issues, Stories and all.

There are many cases where a story is composed of features, bugs, etc - especially issues in other projects.  I get that it's not always desirable to break a story in to smaller parts; but there are times when it is.
fields.summary: Ability to link issues to stories and not just epics

fields.description:
It would be great if we can have an option in JIRA Agile (or JIRA) to automatic add specific created issues to the current Sprint.
Today, we can create a Post Function to change the Sprint field in certain issue types, but we can't discover which one is the current Sprint.
fields.summary: Option to add new Issues to the current Sprint

fields.description: We would like to be able to map statuses in our workflow to more than one column on an agile or Kanban board. Since this will probably not be possible, I would suggest sub-columns on the board which you could move the issues between.
fields.summary: As an enterprise user I would like to be able to have sub columns on KanBan boards

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When changing certain aspects of sprints, including closing them, notifications are sent to all people involved in the sprint. The project 'Notification Scheme' does not allow a SCRUM Master / Project Administrator to tailor which specific notifications people involved in the project receive. Having additional notification options that are specific to sprints would be a great addition to the already extensive list of notification events within the project 'Notification Scheme'

Options like:

- Send emails on Sprint Start
- Send emails on Sprint Close
- Send emails when issues change rank

These would be of great use during sprint planning

h3. Environment
Server
Cloud


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a sprint
# Add issues to your sprint
# Move several issues to a closed / completed state
# End the sprint
# Perform any other combination of sprint related events that generate notifications. i.e., Rank changing


h3. Expected Results
Notifications should be sent to only the people that have been placed in specific notification events


h3. Actual Results
All people involved in a sprint are sent the same notifications

 
h3. Notes
The current set of notification events within Notification Schemes, does not include any Sprint specific notification events.
fields.summary: Better/More options regarding Sprint notifications within JIRA Software

fields.description: As we do a lot of cross project work, having all of the versions and epics appearing in Plan Mode is a bit overwhelming.  Being able to turn off or select which versions and epics we desire to appear in Plan Mode would be very useful.
fields.summary: The ability to turn off a Version or Epic in Plan Mode would be useful.

fields.description:
Hi, 
We find both hours burndown chart and story points burndown chart very useful and we would like all team members to have access to those  We have noticed that we need to give every employee an admin access so they can go in the configuration to switch from one burndown chart to the other. Is it possible that people without admin right can switch from one burndown chart to the other into one click only, without having to access the configuration board exclusive to the Admin?
Thank you in advance for you answer.
fields.summary: Access to both burndown hours chart and story points burndown chart to all users not just admin

fields.description: futureSprints() is fine, but I'd like to limit it just to the next one sometimes.
fields.summary: JQL for nextSprint()

fields.description: Similar to the (*) which indicates an issue was added after the sprint started, include some indicator to show if an issue rolled over to the new sprint.
fields.summary: Provide indication on sprint report that an issue rolled over from a previous sprint

fields.description: The ‘goal’ is to use JIRA Agile to manage the order of what is delivered in a release. With story boards, JIRA Agile is great in that it lets you sort by dragging and dropping stories to re-rank them. If we use JIRA Agile, we need a way to show the ‘rank’ of each item in a list using a 1-N number. In JIRA, as I understand it, those ‘rank’ numbers are ‘internal’ numbers and are very large. These large numbers would need to be converted to 1-N (stakeholder friendly) numbers. So when filters and dashboards are shown, our stakeholders would be able to see that their requested requirement is number 10 out of 30, rather than showing the internal numbers.
fields.summary: As a product owner I want to see my issues in a release in rank order 1-N instead of the internal relative large number used in JIRA

fields.description:
The icons in the Manage Boards screen showing the Board Type (Scrum or Kanban) should be added back, since there is no way to check the board type now in JIRA Agile and we need to open each one to verify this.

Also, this is not duplicated from [GHS-8037|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-8037] since what we want here is to have those icons back to the Application.
fields.summary: Icons showing Board Type in the Manage Boards Screen

fields.description:
Currently, total estimates are only displayed for Sprints:
!SP.png!

It would make a good improvement to have those under the backlogs as well.
fields.summary: Show total estimates for backlogs in plan view

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-9797].
  {panel}

When an issue is moved out of a Sprint before starting it (moved to Backlog or another Sprint) when the Sprint is Started, removed issue will still appear on Sprint Report.

*Steps to reproduce:*
# Create a new Sprint
# Create 3 issues and add them to the sprint
# Move one out
# Start the Sprint
# Look at Sprint Report (the removed issue will be there)
# look at the Burndown report (the Start Sprint event will show only 2 issues, which is correct)
fields.summary: Issue moved out of sprint before start, still shows on reports

fields.description:
cA Product Owner or testers create a lot of tickets in Jira. 
These users take screenshots of the built software, save them on a HDD and use the upload feature of Jira to attach the screenshot to a ticket.

I as a tester and user of jira want to have the possibility to attach a element in the clipboard directly to a jira ticket (without going the way to save and upload). We normally use a screenshot tool, which holds the cut element in the clipboard (which can be pasted to any appropriate app directly).

In a perfect world: Jira offers directly the possibility (via button click) to make a screenshot (rectangular - part of the full screen can than be taken with the mouse and mouse clicks and the result is saved directly as an attachment - only the name needs to be adapted of the attachment)
fields.summary: Attach Clipboard (Graphics) elements to a ticket
Sprint Report does not include Story Points added to a Planned Sprint
Sort on Epic Rank and then Story Rank

fields.description:
As a user of JIRA Agile I have completed a sprint, the completion process informed me that incomplete issue would be moved to the top of the backlog. However the issue shows as being part of a completed sprint and is not visible to other boards. The only workaround is to create anew issue.

I would like the ability to remove such issues from a completed sprint.
fields.summary: Allow issue to be removed from completed sprint

fields.description:
Reproduce:

- Create a sprint and assign some issues to it. 
- Clone one of the issues and move the cloned issue back to the backlog
- Start and complete the sprint
- The sprint report mentions the cloned issue as not completed in the issue table

Problem is in BurndownUtils#addSprintHistoryChanges method. The code makes the assumption that the first change the sprint custom field value of an issue is setting the value to a sprint, not removing it, as is the case with the cloned issue. This causes the the cloned issue to be counted as being part of the sprint, while it was not.
fields.summary: Sprint Report calculation incorrectly includes cloned issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-9783].
  {panel}

The calculation of the scope change is sometimes not correct. 

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Create a sprint in Plan Mode
# Create 5 issues with an estimate of '2' each.
# Add all 5 issues to the future sprint.
# Remove one of the issues from the future sprint.
# Start the sprint with the remaining 4 issues.
# Look at the Sprint Health Gadget - the scope change amount will be 0%.
# Remove another issue from the sprint.
# Look at the Sprint Health Gadget again.

h4. Expected

The scope change amount should be -25% -- 8 points originally in scope, and 2 were removed.

h4. Actual

The scope change amount is -40%.
fields.summary: Sprint Health Gadget scope change calculation is incorrect

fields.description: I have the tool JIRA that currently there are 300 people using, but only one team would use the functions of the Green Hopper. There are how to buy a license only for the team that will use and not for the rest of the company?
fields.summary: Is to implement the Green Hopper to only a certain group in JIRA?

fields.description:
Currently, all of the numeric type of custom-field will be automatically added in to the Estimation Statistic drop down field of the Agile board configuration mode. Customer would like to have ability to remove some of the custom-field from it since not all of them is useful.

h3. Customer point of view
{quote}
When configuring a Scrum board (see attached screenshot): "Story Points", "Original Time Estimate", "Actual Cost", "Estimated Cost", "Estimated Workload", "Frequency", "MECO/ECO", "Number of Affected Users", "Phone", "Process affecting Disturbance", "Project Number", "Rank (Obsolete)" ,"Issue Count" and etc.,
However the only two statistics that seems to work are "Original Time Estimate" and "Issue Count"
We are not interested in other than Original Time Estimate" and "Issue Count"
How to disable other fields in Green Hopper Scrum Board.
{quote}
fields.summary: ability to remove numeric type of custom-field on Estimation Statistic drop down

fields.description:
Hello,

In the current JIRA Agile plugin you need to be project admin of all the participating projects of a sprint to start the sprint (also to create a new sprint).

For our organization this isn't suitable; any developer needs to have the permission to create a sprint and/or to start a sprint. 
However, giving every developer the project administrator permission to every project that may participate in a sprint isn't the best solution either; project specific settings may be modified which is something that we want to prevent.

What I would like to have is a specific permission (that can be assigned) that allows the user to create and/or start a sprint. 

Is this something that can be realized? 
It's something that is giving us headaches for quite some time now :-)

Kind regards,
Koen Werdler, EsperantoXL
fields.summary: Create a seperate permission / role for creating / starting a sprint

fields.summary: Cloning an issue is throwing a null pointer exception

fields.description: We have configured a board with swimlanes based on fixVersion. In some cases, tickets are common to different products and therefore have more than one fixVersion. We would like the option to see in each of the swim lanes, instead of just the first one.
fields.summary: As a product owner, I would like to be able to see a ticket in multiple Kanban swim lanes.

fields.description:
We only add estimates to subtasks, and not to both subtasks and parent tasks (stories.) This helps us avoid double counting of issue totals on Jira reports and pages. Unfortunately, there isn't a good way to group changes outside of an issue type such as epics or subtasks. 

The Jira issue page has an option to include subtasks when seeing the original estimate. This would be helpful on the Details View while using the Agile boards. My stories with subtask estimates are showing 0 under the Estimate field; however, they are showing xx hours under the Remaining field. So, it's misleading that the "Estimate" field only shows the estimate for the main task or story; however, the "Remaining" shows the total remaining for subtasks as well.
fields.summary: Jira Agile should show the subtask total with the Estimate field in the Details View

fields.description:
For example, if a board has Original Estimate configured as the estimation statistic, and then the global "Time Tracking" feature is disabled in JIRA, then you get the error shown in the screenshot.

We should consider gracefully falling back to Issue Count statistic, with a less harsh warning message.
fields.summary: When estimation statistic is no longer valid, Plan Mode does not load and an error message is shown

fields.description:
We currently have our docs organized as follows:
- JIRA Agile 6.3
- GreenHopper 6.2
- GreenHopper 6.1

and so on. However, the link to the GreenHopper 6.2 documentation in the [JIRA Agile Documentation Directory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ALLDOC/JIRA+Agile+Documentation+Directory] is broken. 

It actually seems there is no GreenHopper 6.2 documentation, as https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH is redirected to https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE and https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH62 does not exist.
fields.summary: The GreenHopper 6.2 documentation is broken

fields.description: Ubuntu's default screenshot name is something like "Screenshot from 2013-09-04 10:18:05.png", which is not accepted by the "Attachment" feature. This slows down development and requires users to rename the screenshot before attaching it. Can the file name simply be sanitized on the back-end?
fields.summary: Attachment filename format restrictions slow down development

fields.description:
As a Project Manager I need to change the sequence of my planned Sprints in the Plan-Mode of the Scrum Board.

This is really important for me because I wish to create sprints in the far future and break them down to smaller planned sprints when time goes on.

i.e:

    Sprint KW1-KW2 2014
    Sprint KW3-KW4 2014
    Sprint February 2014
    Sprint March 2014
    Sprint Quartal 2 2014
    Sprint Quartal 3 2014
    Sprint Quartal 4 2014

Many of the customers of //SEIBERT/MEDIA wish to have this feature in order to be able to plan the tasks continuously - as a rolling plan. I would love to have this feature as well. I really hope that you are going to implement it in the near future because it allows project manager to use the agile board even for the more "classic" project management which still many of our customers love. Even for the Agile Planning this feature would bring a lot of advantages.

Please don't hesitate to contact me for any questions. I would really love to see this feature!

Cheers
Björn Frauen
fields.summary: As a Project Manager I need to change the sequence of my planned Sprints in the Plan-Mode of the Scrum Board.

fields.description:
Add an ability to add validation actions for items that enter sprints or when sprints begin. 

Examples:

* A story cannot be added to a sprint (active or planned) unless the ticket has an assignee
* Cannot add to sprint or start sprint until all items in sprint are estimated
* Cannot start sprint without having all issues have assignees
fields.summary: Sprint Validation actions

fields.description: When using the Detail View, vertical space is consumed by custom fields that have no data to display for the issue being viewed. Omitting these fields would be a great way to reclaim vertical space.
fields.summary: As a Rapid Board user, I would like empty fields to be omitted from the Detail View

fields.description:
As a product owner with a backlog of multiple projects i would be able to define filter which will only display the epics witch match the given SQL Filter.

for example if is select the filter "project = Myproject1" i only want to see the epics of Myproject1 at the left side navigation to get a better overview!
fields.summary: Filter should also Filter the EPICS in the Navigation
